thread.title: New Market Report Polishes in Hungary
thread.title_full: New Market Report Polishes in Hungary | MENAFN.COM

author: Press
title: New Market Report Polishes in Hungary
text:
(MENAFN Press) Polishes saw both retail volume and current value sales decreases in 2014. This was due to the steep decline in metal polish sales as the leading brand Sidol by Henkel was withdrawn from the market. However the demand for other types of polish remained largely positive in 2014. Customers are price sensitive and they seek the “best” prices which helped economy and private label brands to gain ground on more expensive commercial brands. Thanks to the widening range of cheaper products and more moderate unit price movement consumers were able to raise or maintain their volume purchases for key polishes. Nonetheless the strong decline in sales of metal polish affected the whole category negatively.
Full Report Details at
 - 
Competitive Landscape
Henkel Magyarország leads polishes in 2014 with a 34% share of retail value sales. Henkel continued to lose share as its Sidol brand was withdrawn from metal polish. The company offers standard and premium brands that are well-known and have been present in Hungary for a long time. It covers all types of polishes except metal polish and advertises brand/products regularly.
Industry Prospects
Polishes is predicted to remain a stable but mature home care category over the forecast period. As the demand for polishes is limited and customers can easily give up these products if their spending power weakens leading producers are not expected to invest in product development. Thus customers will find the same polishes as in the review period. Meanwhile retail volume sales growth is expected as less expensive private label and commercial brands appear. Thus the leading producers will face price competition with emerging private label and cheaper commercial brands and they will have to keep their prices which will benefit customers.
